Around 2 May 2016, members of the hacktivist group affiliated with Anonymous protested in front of the Department of Justice in Manila, Metro Manila to demand the release of their member who defaced the Commission on Elections (Comelec) website the previous month and to demand Comelec to implement the security features of vote counting machines (VCMs).
Arrests: On 2 May 2016, police arrested the commanding officer of the New People's Army (NPA) Regional Operational Command, Ricardo Andan Manili, in Brgy. Remedios, Las Nieves, Agusan del Norte.
On 2 May 2016, in (North) Upi town area, Maguindanao, unidentified armed men shot dead a Liberal Party (LP) member who is a supporter of three electorial candidates in the ARMM provinces and region.

On 3 May 2016, unidentified armed men shot dead a village chair who waas onboard a motorcycle in Brgy. Marber, Bansalan, Davao del Sur. His companion, a tribal leader, was also wounded.

Strikes: On 4 May 2016, 461 workers of Manila Cordage Company (MCC) and Manco Synthetics Inc. (MSI) erected a protest camp outside the premises of a rope-manufacturing factory (Carmelray Industrial Park) in Calamba City, Laguna to oppose labor contracting.
On 4 May 2016, a homemade bomb planted by unidentified assailants exploded in front of the house of Basilan provincial governor Jum Akbar in Isabela City, Basilan. No one was hurt in the incident.

assoc_actor_1: APP: Alliance of Parties for Progress
source: Rappler; Manila Times; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 4 May 2016, a policeman was killed in an attack by armed bodyguards of Tampilisan Mayoral and an Alliance of Parties for Progess (APP) Candidate in Brgy. Camul, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.
On 4 May 2016, four explosions occurred near Divisoria Elementary School in Divisoria, Catingan, Masbate where vote counting machines and other election materials were stored.

On 5 May 2016, two men were killed in separate clashes between supporters of the Nationalist People's Coalition (NPC) mayoral and supporters of Liberal Party (LP) rival candidates in Brgy. Maoyon and Sta. Lourdes in Puerto Princesa town, Palawan. Both groups pelted stones and shot darts at each other.

Property destruction: On 5 May 2016, unidentified armed motorcycle-riding men threw a grenade at the house of a Vice Mayor reelectionist of Marawi City, Lanao del Sur, which damaged the vice mayor's Toyota pick-up truck and two other vehicles parked nearby. Grenades also exploded near the infirmary of the Mindanao State University (MSU) in Marawi City.

Health workers staged a protest on 6 May 2016 at the Department of Health (DOH), Manila, Metro Manila on the occasion of Health Workers' Day demanding wage increases, safe working conditions and an end to contractualization and privatization. [size=hundreds]

source: Union of Catholic Asian News; Campaign for Human Rights Philippines; Front Line Defenders
notes: On 6 May 2016, in Talacogon, Agusan del Norte, members of the Dela Mance Paramilitary group affiliated with Alamara killed a Talaandig (Lumad) tribal leader in the remote area of Katigbaw, over allegations of being an NPA member because of his opposition to local mining activities.

On 6 May 2016, a reelectionist city councilor of Tanauan City, Batangas was shot dead by an unidentified armed man in Brgy. Darasa, Tanauan City, Batangas. One of the official's security aide was also wounded.

On 6 May 2016, unidentified motorcycle-riding armed men open fired at a jeepney vehicles aboard passengers who are suspected flying voters in Brgy. Tatayawan, Tamparan, Lanao del Sur. Two died and several others were wounded during the incident.
On 6 May 2016, two village councilors of Tinambac, Camarines Sur were shot and wounded by unidentified armed men while the victims were onboard a motorcycle going to the town center.

On 6 May 2016, unidentified armed men shot at houses of two village chiefs and a businessman who are known supporters of a Nationalist People's Coalition (NPC) leader in Baliuag, Bulacan. No one was hurt.

On 7 May 2016, bodies of slain victims of alleged summary execution by unidentified armed men were found in Sitio Sampalukan, Brgy. Lambingan, Tanza, Cavite. The locals expressed belief that the killings were drug-related.

On 7 May 2016, unidentified armed men went inside the home of independent mayoral candidate in Brgy. Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon and shot him dead.

On 7 May 2016, a firefight occurred between suspected New People's Army (NPA) members and 2 soldiers in Sitio Mamhot, Brgy. Manaybanay, Mapanas, Northern Samar. One soldier was killed while the other one wounded in a landmine explosion. Three other civilians were injured. The soldiers delivered vote counting machines (VCM) in another town when they were waylaid.

On 8 May 2016, unidentified assailants set two explosions at a town center of Datu Unsay, Maguindanao. No one was reportedly hurt in the incident.

On 8 May 2016, suspected supporters of reelectionist Mulanay Mayor of the Liberal Party (LP) open fired at the vehicle of supporters of a former Mulanay Mayor of the United Nationalist Alliance (UNA) in Brgy. F. Nanadiego, Mulanay, Quezon. 1 policeman was wounded while the others were safe.

On 8 May 2016, unidentified armed men shot dead 2 supporters of a Presidential candidate and Estancia mayoral candidate of the Nationalist People's Coalition (NPC) in Brgy. Pani-an, Balasan, Iloilo. This has been tagged by the Philippine National Police (PNP) as the first election-related killing in the town.

On 8 May 2016, 3 New People's Army (NPA) snipers fired at an army team conducting election security operations in Brgy. Roxas, Lope De Vega, Northern Samar. One soldier was killed during the incident.

On 8 May 2016, unidentified armed men shot wounded a supporter of a Dimasalag mayoral candidate in Brgy. Balucawi, Dimasalang, Masbate. Nearby residents also reported presence of armed men in their area.
On 8 May 2016, one member of the Buisan clan Maguidanao was killed by unidentified armed men who are allegedly linked to the Sabal clan in Talitay, Maguindanao.
Assumed on 8 May 2016, shortly before midnight, unidentified armed men burned down a Brgy. hall in Brgy. Katipunan, Guipos, Zamboanga del Sur, leaving one worker wounded.
Assumed on 8 May 2016, unidentified armed men fired M203 rifle grenades at the house of Mayor Alber Balindong in Tugaya area, Lanao del Sur. Retaliatory fire was also heard from the Mayor's house.

On 8 May 2016, in Brgy. Poblacion 2, Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao, a grenade planted by unidentified armed men exploded near the mansion of an ARMM governor who is allegedly linked to election-related Maguindanao Massacre of 2009 which killed 58 victims. A minor girl was killed and three others injured.

On 9 May 2016, Election day, unidentified armed men fired at a board of election inspectors (BEI) convoy containing voting paraphernalia, leaving one dead and another two wounded in Marawi City, Lanao del Sur. In the same city in Plaza Villa, Bangola, unidentified armed men attacked a polling center.

On 9 May 2016, Election day, several voters protested in front of a voting precinct in Brgy. 3, San Francisco, Agusan del Sur against the board of election inspectors (BEIs) for disallowing the voters to feed their own ballots to the new Vote Counting Machine (VCM) which replaced a malfunctioning VCM.
On 9 May 2016, Election day, a councilor and mayoral candidate under the Nacionalista Party and his companion were shot wounded by 3 motorcycle-riding armed men in Brgy. Antiana, San Jorge, Samar.
On 9 May 2016, Election day, an M203 grenade planted by unidentified assailants exploded near Dimayon Elementary School in Dimayon, Tagoloan, Lanao del Norte. No one was hurt during the incident.

notes: On 9 May 2016, on election day, a firefight occurred between supporters of 2 mayoral candidates (assumed between rivals Jodel Crisologo of National Unity Party and Jendricks Luna of Lakas-CMD) in Brgy. Pang-ot, Lagayan, Abra, leaving one village watchman dead and two others wounded.

Non-violent activity: On 9 May 2016, Election day, unidentified assailants started 2 simultaneous explosions with 40-mm rifle grenades in Brgy. Kitapak, Datu Saudi Ampatuan, Maguindanao. No casualties or further information reported.
On 9 May 2016, Election day, two unidentified armed supporters attacked and severely injured a voter in Brgy. Manongkaling, Mamasapano, Maguindanao.

On 9 May 2016, a 4-minute firefight ensued between the New People's Army (NPA) members and the army around Sitio Colonia, Brgy. Pange, Matnog, Sorsogon. 2 soldiers were wounded when their truck hit a landmine planted by the NPAs.

On 9 May 2016, on election day, supporters of 2 political parties clashed which left one person dead and another wounded in Marantao, Lanao del Sur. (The political affiliations of the involved actors are unclear.)

On 9 May 2016, Election day, a bomb by unidentified armed men exploded near Mamasabulod Elementary School in Pagalungan area, Maguindanao, where a re-electionist mayor was casting his vote. No one was hurt during the incident and the voting continued later in the day.
On 9 May 2016, Election day, unidentified armed men shot & wounded one civilian at Hamidhalin Elementary School in Jolo town area, Sulu.

Non-violent activity: On 9 May 2016, Election day, unidentified armed men launched three successive rifle grenade explosions near Sultan Mastura Elementary School in Brgy. Tapayan, Sultan Mastura, Maguindanao. No one was hurt and voting continued despite the explosions.
On 9 May 2016, two separate explosion took place in Shariff Aguak town area, Maguindanao. No casualties reported.

On 9 May 2016, Election day, one person was shot dead during an armed clash between two groups supporting different mayoral candidates (from LP and UNA )in Tambunan Central Elementary School in Tambunan, Guindulungan, Maguindanao (The political affiliations of the involved actors are unclear).

source: Philippine Star; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Manila Times
notes: On 9 May 2016, Election day, armed partisans fired a 40 millimeter shoulder-fire projectile which killed a civilian in Datu Unsay, Maguindanao. One other explosion occurred in the town which left another civilian wounded. The attack was perpetuated allegedly by a political candidate.

On 9 May 2016, Election day, unidentified armed men open fired at a jeepney and 2 motorcycles aboard supporters of Rosario Mayor in Brgy. Wawa 3, Rosario, Cavite. The passengers were out to check alleged vote-buying in the area when they were waylaid and shot dead at close range. 7 were killed during the incident.

On 9 May 2016, Election day, in Mamasapano area, Maguindanao, 3 supporters of a mayoral candidate were shot wounded by unidentified armed men who are linked to a key suspect of election-related Maguindanao Massacre of 2009 which killed 58 victims. (The political affiliations of the involved actors are unclear.)
On 9 May 2016, Election day, unidentified assailants were involved in a bombing incident in Brgy. Laum, Maimbung, Sulu, leaving one civilian wounded.

Property destruction: Assumed on 9 May 2016, Election day, unidentified assailants burned down Ragayan Elementary School, a polling centers in Ragayan, Poona Bayabao, Lanao del Sur.
On 9 May 2016, Election day, a bystander was killed in a grenade blast by unidentified armed men in Cotabato City, Maguindanao.

Youth groups from Kabataan Partylist and League of Filipino Students staged a rally on 9 May 2016 at the Philippine International Convention Center (PICC) in Manila, Metro Manila, the national canvassing venue, to protest against electoral fraud during national elections held on this day. [size=no report]

On 11 May 2016, unidentified armed men open fired at the house of a reelected councilor under the Liberal Party, leaving her dead in Shariff Aguak town area, Maguindanao.
On 11 May 2016, unidentified assailants threw a grenade into a primary school in Mohammad Ajul in Basilan province, where votes were being counted. No reported casualties.

On 12 May 2016, around 1,000 people went to the Makati City quarangle in Makati City, Metro Manila to protest against the result of local elections and to show support for their mayoral bet of the Liberal Party who was defeated by a United Nationalist Alliance (UNA) candidate.

On 13 and 14 May 2016, a firefight between the two rival Buisan and Sabal political clans occurred, killing three clan members and displacing around 15,000 people in Talitay town area, Maguindanao. (Fatalities coded over two days.)

On 14 May 2016, 2 unidentified motorcycle-riding armed men shot dead a village chief while the victim was aboard a motorcycle around Brgy. J. Leviste, Laurel, Batangas.

On 13 and 14 May 2016, a firefight between the two rival Buisan and Sabal political clans occurred, killing three clan members and displacing around 15,000 people in Talitay town area, Maguindanao. (Fatalities coded over two days.)

Environmental groups and local residents launched a barricade on 14 May 2016 in Santa Cruz, Zambales to stop trucks of the Zambales Diversified Minerals Corporation (ZDMC) from loading. Reports indicate that the barricade lasted at least until July 2016.
A drug suspect was killed during a shootout with the police at Brgy. Bulua, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental on 16 May 2016. A civilian was also killed.

On 18 May 2016, a firefight occurred between the New People's Army (NPA) members and the military in Sitio Tugpahan, Brgy. Imelda, Laak, Davao de Oro. No one was hurt in the incident.

On 18 May 2016, a firefight occurred between the New People's Army (NPA) members and the Army's 60th Infantry Battalion Sitio Booy, Brgy. Pimamuno, San Isidro, Davao del Norte, leaving three NPAs and one soldier killed.
On 18 May 2016, an elderly man was shot dead by 3 men who claimed to be members of the New People's Army (NPA) in Brgy. Trinidad, Guihulngan City, Negros Oriental .

A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men. His slain body was found at Macam Street, Brgy. Taal, Bocaue, Bulacan on 18 May 2016, with a sign strapped to his neck, Huwag niyo akong tularan drug pusher ako ('Do not emulate me. I am a drug pusher').

On 19 May 2016, around 800 people went to the city hall in Makati, Metro Manila, to protest against the result of local elections and to show support for their mayoral bet of the Liberal Party who was defeated by a United Nationalist Alliance (UNA) candidate.

Teachers and support staff who served in the May 9 national elections held a protest on 19 May 2016 at the Philippine International Convention Center (PICC) inin Manila, Metro Manila, the main canvassing venue, demanding the release of compensation.

On 19 May 2016, unidentified armed men ambushed a team of police who were about to serve a warrant of arrest to a man charged with murder, illegal firearms possession and piracy in Brgy. Sinusayan, Malangas, Zamboanga Sibugay. One police station commander was wounded.

Members of the Parents' Movement Against K to 12 (PMAK) protested at the Department of Education (DepEd), Pasig City, Metro Manila on 20 May 2016 asking for the K to 12 education program to be abolished.
Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Pantalan, Brgy. Malaban, Binan, Laguna on 20 May 2016.

Datablao, Columbio, Sultan Kudarat. Four soldiers and around two NPA members were injured in the fight.

On 25 May 2016, the military announced seizure of an encampment from the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) led by Idang Susukan in Gulangan, Maimbung, Maguindanao. No battle was mentioned and no casualties or fatalities were recorded as well.

On 26 May 2016, teachers, including the Alliance of Concerned Teachers-Philippines (ACT-Philippines), protested against the delayed payment of honoraria by the Commission on Elections (Comelec) in Manila, Metro Manila.

Drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Brgy. Bigte, Norzagaray, Bulacan on 26 May 2016. Four others who were in the vicinity during the raid were arrested.

A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at Brgy. Cabcaben, Mariveles, Bataan on 26 May 2016.
